title: How to Remove Paint Glaze from Walls

steps.headline: Use fine grit sandpaper.
steps.description: Sand over the glazed area of the wall to de-gloss the glaze. The sanding will remove the sheen so that paint has a surface which can "grip" when new paint is reapplied.

steps.headline: Dampen a clean rag.
steps.description: Wipe down the walls to remove any sanding dust.

steps.headline: Paint anew.
steps.description: You'll need to repaint because you'll have sanded off some of the underlying layer of paint. Add a coat of paint over the top of the roughed-up glaze. If you're making a drastic color change (from dark to light), cover the wall first with a coat of primer.

steps.headline: Purchase TSP cleaner.
steps.description: This is usually sold at hardware or paint stores.

steps.headline: Wash the wall with the TSP mixed with water as directed on the container.
Rinse.
steps.description: You'll must rinse the TSP from the wall. Use clean water to do this.

steps.headline: Check the wall for glaze.
steps.description: If you see no change or missed areas, repeat.

text: Sanding Use fine grit sandpaper. Sand over the glazed area of the wall to de-gloss the glaze. The sanding will remove the sheen so that paint has a surface which can "grip" when new paint is reapplied. Dampen a clean rag. Wipe down the walls to remove any sanding dust. Allow the wall to dry.  Paint anew. You'll need to repaint because you'll have sanded off some of the underlying layer of paint. Add a coat of paint over the top of the roughed-up glaze. If you're making a drastic color change (from dark to light), cover the wall first with a coat of primer. Allow to dry.  TSP Cleaner Purchase TSP cleaner. This is usually sold at hardware or paint stores. Wash the wall with the TSP mixed with water as directed on the container.  Rinse. You'll must rinse the TSP from the wall. Use clean water to do this. Check the wall for glaze. If you see no change or missed areas, repeat.
